intro: Sisyrinchium teleanthum, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically arranged in clusters at the tips of its stems. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Sisyrinchium teleanthum is often found in dry, open habitats such as rocky slopes and gravelly soils.
